comments:
Introduction to Astrophysics II is a basic course for majors in astronomy, in other physical sciences, and in engineering that covers stars, galaxies, and the evolution of the universe.

The reviews on the course were very mixed. The majority of the reviews did mention that the course and its theories were difficult to grasp and could perhaps have used “more structure”; however, it was also described as “interesting” and “too basic.” One student wrote that the class “lived up to and exceeded all my expectations.”

Professor Jain was highly regarded as “approachable” and “exciting” as well as praised for injecting comedy into his lectures. One student said he was “great at lecturing,” but another said it would have been nice if he offered “practice tests or questions before exams.”

This course fulfills the physical world sector. Its prerequisites are Math114 and Phys151, though they can be taken concurrently. The course is math heavy and is recommended for astronomy, engineering, or other physical science majors.
